items.title: The Aria Salvatrice Arcane module gets 404 errors downloading fortunes
items.body:
The Aria Salvatrice "Arcane" module was designed to download a new fortune every day, to randomize the behavior of the synth module. This content is downloaded from Github in JSON files with a year/month/day file structure.

It appears that Aria Salvatrice, the original author of this module, has moved on to other projects, and is unfortunately no longer actively maintaining the daily JSON file generation.

The plugins/AriaModules/src/Arcane.cpp file has a function called downloadTodaysFortune() that attempts to download the fortune files. Later, the downloaded file data is used elsewhere in the module.

It appears from a casual glance at the code that it is resilient in the face of the file not being available.

I'm not sure what _should_ be done about it. Disabling the download feature altogether seems like one obvious possibility. Creating some sort of deterministic random fortune generator that doesn't depend on downloading content from remote servers might be another, although it becomes harder to divine the original author's wishes in that case.

Thank you for creating Cardinal, it's really fantastic! Please take this report in the spirit of a grateful new user of the program noticing something that you might be interested in knowing.

items.title: Missing dpf/ directory contents in 22.03 release tarball
items.body:
Hello!

I tried to build Cardinal from source, using the 22.03 release tarball. Unfortunately, it seems to be missing some files that are present if you check the code out from Github.

Specifically, the dpf/ directory seems to be empty in the release tarball.

When I ran `make`, I hit an error on Makefile line 105, due to HAVE_OPENGL not being true. At first I wasn't sure what was going on, so I set the HAVE_ variables manually. But after clearing that hurdle, then the "include dpf/Makefile.base.mk" line in the Makefile on line 16 was triggered, with dpf/Makefile.base.mk not being found.

Upon closer inspection, nothing was in the dpf/ directory at all.

When I check out the code using `git clone --recursive https://github.com/DISTRHO/Cardinal.git`, the dpf/ directory has a bunch of stuff in it. I predict good things for my attempt to compile the code directly from Github.

Anyway, I just thought you'd like to know, so that the missing files can be included in the next release tarball.

Thanks for doing the work to get this project going. It looks really excellent! I had held off diving into VCV Rack before, since I want everything to be an LV2 plug-in. The open source community delivers again!

items.title: Crash on closing UI after adding module via tag filter/search
items.body:
Super weird situation.
The plugin crashes after closing the UI IFF we have added a module via plugin browser with a tag set.

Details from IRC:
```
07:54 < dingodoppelt> I get crashes when closing the ui. not every module does it though. I'm using the lv2 in carla.
07:54 < dingodoppelt> [carla] Carla assertion failure: "unlocked" in file ../utils/CarlaSemUtils.hpp, line 182
07:58 < dingodoppelt> happens for almost every filter module
08:04 < dingodoppelt> wait, it seems to depend on where i load the module from. if i choose it from the big list -> no crash. when i filter by "Tags" for "Filter" the loaded module crashes
08:06 < dingodoppelt> filtering by brand seems to work fine, filtering by tags not so much
09:37 < falktx> this a little bit more rigorous criteria/details of the crash
09:48 < dingodoppelt> i can always trigger the crash in the same way. open browser, filter by tags, add some module, close the ui by hitting "X" in the top right corner.
09:48 < dingodoppelt> doesn't work with every module but most of which i tried (randomly)
09:49 < dingodoppelt> if i load the same module without having used "filter by tag" it doesn't crash
10:05 < dingodoppelt> http://62.113.206.82/crash.mkv
10:05 < dingodoppelt> the module i loaded is just a random one. happens for others as well
10:07 < dingodoppelt> i'm just building from scratch to check with a freshly cloned and compiled version
10:15 < dingodoppelt> same thing with the freshly compiled plugin
10:16 < dingodoppelt> how can i be more helpful? debug build?
10:41 < dreamer> dingodoppelt: what does the logs tab say?
10:42 < dreamer> (just wondering)
10:44 < dreamer> ok can reproduce in carla
10:45 < dreamer> and that is with build from yesterday
10:45 < dreamer> load lv2, search tag filter, select autin bass. close ui -> segfault carla
10:48 < dingodoppelt> happens for me only when i filter the modules
10:49 < dreamer> yeah, really odd
10:49 < dreamer> semantically it doesn't make any sense to me. it's the exact same module. what would be different about it?
10:49 < dingodoppelt> that's what i thought

```

items.title: Use of `_GLIBCXX_ASSERTIONS` causes many codepaths to fail
items.body:
At least 2 assertion failures can be seen:
1. Loading a previously saved Cardinal plugin state (e.g. in Carla)
2. Adding Bogaudio pressor to the rack

Assertions so far are all related to `std::vector` use.
For example Bogaudio one:
```
/usr/include/c++/11.2.0/bits/stl_vector.h:1045: std::vector<_Tp, _Alloc>::reference std::vector<_Tp, _Alloc>::operator[](std::vector<_Tp, _Alloc>::size_type) [with _Tp = rack::engine::Output; _Alloc = std::allocator<rack::engine::Output>; std::vector<_Tp, _Alloc>::reference = rack::engine::Output&; std::vector<_Tp, _Alloc>::size_type = long unsigned int]: Assertion '__n < this->size()' failed.
```

items.title: Please fix LTO to work with FreeBSD clang
items.body:
This is a continuation of the LTO discussion in https://github.com/DISTRHO/Cardinal/issues/128

It looks like LTO as implemented only works with gcc.

clang uses thin-LTO, as described [here](https://clang.llvm.org/docs/ThinLTO.html).

A good practical example would be any cmake project with enabled LTO built with clang.

LTO can be enabled in cmake by adding these lines:
> set(CMAKE_INTERPROCEDURAL_OPTIMIZATION TRUE)
> cmake_policy(SET CMP0069 NEW)

items.title: Add FPS rate limiter (none, 2x or 4x)
items.body:
After discovering high CPU usage on one of my (reasonably simple) patches, I ran a few tests of Cardinal+Carla vs. plain VCV Rack (both on PulseAudio output). Since I have a HiDPI laptop (i7-10875H CPU @ 2.30GHz, 3840x2160) with struggling Intel graphics, I've limited VCV Rack to 15 fps.

The patch uses 60% of one core in plain VCV rack (shown in `top`).

The same patch uses 100% of one core (shown in `top`) in Cardinal, with the plugin window open. At that time, Carla's DSP load only goes up to 60-70%. If I close the plugin window, the same patch then drops to 50% (in `top`) of one core (DSP load shows 40-50%), which leads me to conclude it's graphics-related.

The patch is attached, but I don't think it depends on the patch.
[snare.zip](https://github.com/DISTRHO/Cardinal/files/7887707/snare.zip)

items.title: Cardinal Host Time - Clock not receiving the BPM from Reaper (LV2 plugin)
items.body:
Scenario:
------------
Load cardinal Host as a module within cardinal
Load Clocked module and link cardinal host time "Clock" to Clocked modules BPM (to try and synch them)

Expected
------------
Correct BPM should be received from Reaper (displayed when hovered over the output from TimeHost, the clock should synch with reaper)

Actual
------------
0 is shown on the Clock and Beat Output and the "clkd" module's BPM is not synched.

Note 1: As a test, I swapped for the "Playing" to see if any comms was working and it did send 10v when reaper was playing and 0 when stopped. I also tried the other bar phrases etc. and they all changed the BPM (wildly as expecte, but it worked)

Note 2: It appears to be the Beat that takes on the actual BPM from Reaper (from some experiments) watching the flashing led on the HostTime module. What does the clock represent ?

Note 3: I tried swapping the Mode to P16/P24/CV etc. (nt that I really know the reasoning, but had lno effect to synch reaper and host (did change the values however)

items.title: Missing maximize/minimize buttons on Gnome (fix suggested)
items.body:
I am investigating an issue with Gnome where the standalone lacks the minimize and maximize buttons.
It seems that [the hints in `pugl.cpp`](https://github.com/DISTRHO/DPF/blob/62ba84882410fd7ca3fcbfe417a731494b57cf2d/dgl/src/pugl.cpp#L624-L625) are responsible for this.

The window types are important for window managers, especially with tiling window managers.
I have found that removing the `DIALOG` hint or swapping the lines solves the issue of missing buttons on Gnome.
I made some combinatorial testing using i3 and although I don't use i3 myself, it doesn't look like a very blocking or huge change, see the pictures below. It is always easy to switch the mode in i3.

i3 users, I welcome your input on this! :computer: 

X provides several other window types: https://specifications.freedesktop.org/wm-spec/latest/ar01s05.html
Some are worth looking into.

![without_startup](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2551484/146297286-87e87edf-b62e-4a56-a591-f2bc2c71cfac.png)
[with DIALOG (floating disabled with mod+shift+space)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2551484/146297277-63b2a56b-68ee-45c7-9a2f-75b22bd0580c.png)
[with DIALOG (on start)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2551484/146297280-5f6f2e6c-6bf7-48a1-a344-5065bab52128.png)
[without DIALOG (floating enabled with mod+shift.space)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2551484/146297283-76e793f8-f991-4488-b44c-5a279b9d75ce.png)
[without DIALOG (tabbed with mod+w)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2551484/146297284-451ac373-84fd-4fc9-aaac-2941d0bbe19a.png)
Swapping the lines has the same effect.

items.title: [WIP] 8 CV input expander for parameters (Ildaeil, Carla plugin host)
items.body:
Pretty basic for now, 8 parameters of the loaded plugin can be automated.
If inputs are connected, the expander "steals" the UI control, if unconnected, the user controls it.

Note that this is a *left*-side expander.
There has been some discussion about using the more common convention of right side.

I've made it left-side to experiment with the pattern of constructing chains of expanding modules: here this expander adds (parameters) inputs to the left, and future expanders for outputs could use the right side.

TODO:
- Actually testing and use it!
- ~Mark the parameter visually in the UI when the expander "stole" it.~ Done in cea5099
- Mark the inputs (red/green leds?) on the expander when there is a matching parameter in the plugin (to handle case where plugin has less than 8 parameters)

Notes for future improvements:
- An output expander for "output parameters", marked as readonly in LV2, such as levels from analysers etc.
